unnormalised: My Guru Ji from Rishikesh always emphasized the eight limbs of Yoga, as outlined in Patanjali's Yoga Sutras. Think about it – there’s Yama (ethical restraints), Niyama (observances), Pranayama (breath control), Pratyahara (withdrawal of senses), Dharana (concentration), Dhyana (meditation) and Samadhi (bliss). The asanas are just one limb!

unnormalised: I've found incorporating even a little bit of Pranayama into my daily routine has made a huge difference. Anulom Vilom for 5 minutes in the morning? Life-changing! Plus, focusing on the Yamas and Niyamas – things like truthfulness and contentment – has really impacted my mental well-being.
